AttackerCapabilities: Ability to analyze HTML source code

Steps.Description: Exploit the XSS vulnerability to inject malicious LaTeX script

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to exploit the XSS vulnerability to execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the target's browser.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts a LaTeX script payload that will execute JavaScript code when viewed on the website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully injects the malicious LaTeX script into the website.

Steps.Description: Submit the malicious LaTeX script to trigger XSS and leak admin cookies

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to trigger the XSS vulnerability and retrieve the admin cookies.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker submits the malicious LaTeX script and observes the resulting output.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully triggers the XSS vulnerability and retrieves the admin cookies.

Steps.Description: Analyze the website's HTML source code

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to inspect the HTML source code for potential vulnerabilities or hidden information.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker analyzes the HTML source code of the website.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers an interesting comment with a link to download the src.zip file.

Steps.Description: Download and analyze the source code

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects to find vulnerabilities or sensitive information in the website's source code.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker downloads and analyzes the source code from the src.zip file.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers an if statement where the real flag is set into a cookie.

Steps.Description: Craft and set malicious cookies to steal admin session

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to steal the admin session by manipulating cookies.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts and sets the necessary cookies to mimic the admin session.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully steals the admin session by changing their cookie.

Steps.Description: Access the list functionality to retrieve the flag

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker expects to find the flag within the list functionality.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker accesses the list functionality with the stolen admin session.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker retrieves the flag from the FLAG cookie.
